Encrypting is not the hard part; it's keeping track of all the keys.

How many secret keys should we even have? Maybe 1...? That's very risky.
They really use unique session keys for each piece of data. JEEZ that's a lot of keys.

![](image-kl2pfk3r.png)

We change the keys every 3 months.

![](image-kl2pguhc.png)

![](image-kl2phn7p.png)
